page.title: 09Education in the area
page.content: The only school in our area is the Empingham C of E Primary which takes children from 5 to 11 years old. The present modern school was open by Lord Sandford in 1973, deputising for Mrs. Margaret Thatcher. This replaced the former school given to the village last century by the Ancasters. Numbers on roll have dropped from 120 to 38 with only two teachers. Children are taught in groups allowing each child to develop at their own rate. School meals are prepared on the premises. At 11+ children are transferred to Casterton Community College and at 16+ to Rutland Sixth Form College. A few children in the area go to public schools at Oakham and Stamford. One classroom is used by a preschool playgroup, privately run.
